title: Navtej Singh Johar v. Union of India
summary: Landmark judgment decriminalizing consensual sexual acts between adults. Partially struck down Section 377 IPC.
keyholding: Consensual sexual acts between adults in private are not criminalized. Section 377 partially decriminalized.
impact: Historic judgment protecting LGBTQ+ rights and privacy

title: Kesavananda Bharati v. State of Kerala
summary: Established the doctrine of basic structure of the Constitution. Limited Parliament's amending power.
keyholding: Parliament cannot amend the basic structure of the Constitution.
impact: Protects fundamental rights and constitutional framework

title: Nirbhaya Case (Mukesh Singh v. State of Delhi)
summary: 2012 Delhi rape case. Four perpetrators convicted and sentenced to death for gang rape and murder.
keyholding: Rarest of rare cases deserve death penalty. Brutal rape and murder warrant capital punishment.
impact: Led to stricter rape laws (Criminal Law Amendment Act 2013)

title: Selvi v. State of Karnataka
summary: Landmark judgment on validity of narco-analysis and lie-detector tests. Banned involuntary administration.
keyholding: Narco-analysis and lie-detector tests violate right to life and bodily integrity when done involuntarily.
impact: Protects rights of accused during interrogation

title: Shayara Bano v. Union of India
summary: Triple talaq declared unconstitutional. Granted women protection from arbitrary divorce.
keyholding: Triple talaq is unconstitutional and void. Women have right to maintain marriage.
impact: Empowered Muslim women and protected marital rights

title: Mitthibai College v. Veeramachaneni Rajasekhar
summary: Case on cheating and fraud in educational institution. Established liability of institutions.
keyholding: Educational institutions can be held liable for cheating practices.
impact: Consumer protection in education sector

title: K. Veeraswami v. Union of India
summary: Upheld constitutionality of Section 377 IPC. Later overruled by Navtej Singh Johar.
keyholding: Section 377 was initially held constitutional (later changed in 2018).
impact: Case now considered a landmark in showing evolution of rights jurisprudence

title: Association for Democratic Reforms v. Union of India
summary: Electoral Bonds Scheme struck down as unconstitutional. Violates citizens' right to information.
keyholding: Electoral bonds anonymous scheme violates Article 19(1)(a). Citizens have right to know funding sources.
impact: Ensures transparency in political funding

title: Savitri Devi v. State of Punjab
summary: Dowry death case. Woman killed by husband and in-laws. Conviction upheld with life imprisonment.
keyholding: Dowry-related deaths attract severest punishment. Presumption against accused in Section 498A cases.
impact: Stringent enforcement of dowry laws and protection of women

title: State of Bihar v. Rajesh Prasad
summary: Theft case establishing distinction between theft and dacoity. Important for criminal liability.
keyholding: Five or more persons with common intention constitutes dacoity, not mere theft.
impact: Clarified criminal classifications and sentencing guidelines

title: Sushil Kumar Singh v. Government of Bihar
summary: Armed robbery case distinguishing between robbery and dacoity. Important criminal precedent.
keyholding: Criminal force must be used in presence of victim for robbery; dacoity has broader scope.
impact: Clarified criminal offense definitions

title: Shiv Sagar Singh v. State of Bihar
summary: Landmark cheating case. Established essentials for proving cheating and fraud.
keyholding: Cheating requires dishonest inducement and delivery of property. Intent is crucial.
impact: Set precedent for fraud cases and cyber fraud

title: Vinay Tyagi v. Irshad Ali Khan
summary: Defamation case balancing free speech and reputation. Established standards for defamation.
keyholding: Truth is absolute defense in defamation. Reputation must be balanced against free expression.
impact: Protected journalistic freedom while safeguarding reputation

title: R. Rajagopal v. State of Tamil Nadu
summary: Publisher case. Established right to privacy and journalistic freedom limits.
keyholding: Right to privacy is constitutionally protected. Publishers have responsibility for accuracy.
impact: Balanced privacy rights with freedom of press

title: Bilkis Bano v. State of Gujarat
summary: Landmark gang rape case from 2002 riots. Supreme Court quashed premature remission granted to convicts.
keyholding: Premeditated gang rape warrants life imprisonment. Remission must follow due process.
impact: Strengthened victim protection and accountability

title: Aravind Kedar Mahajan v. State of Maharashtra
summary: Criminal breach of trust case. Established liability for misappropriation of entrusted property.
keyholding: Breach of trust occurs when person entrusted with property dishonestly misappropriates it.
impact: Protects trust and fiduciary relationships

title: Soumitro v. State of West Bengal
summary: Landmark case on common intention. Established that common intention can be inferred from circumstances.
keyholding: Common intention can be inferred from circumstances; no agreement in writing necessary.
impact: Set precedent for prosecuting group crimes

title: Suresh Gupta v. Government of Delhi
summary: Child trafficking case. Established strict provisions for trafficking prosecution.
keyholding: Trafficking of minors attracts severest punishment. Onus on accused to prove innocence.
impact: Strengthened child protection laws

title: State of Rajasthan v. Bhati
summary: Cheating through false pretenses. Established standards for proving dishonest inducement.
keyholding: Cheating requires active misrepresentation; silence alone does not constitute cheating.
impact: Clarified consumer fraud prosecutions

title: Maneka Gandhi v. Union of India
summary: Landmark judgment expanding right to life. Established expanded interpretation of Article 21.
keyholding: Right to life extends beyond mere survival to include dignity and livelihood.
impact: Expanded fundamental rights protections significantly
